review: It was a complete disappointment -- I thought I would be able to stream movies or my own video files from a notebook or a smartphone, or at least broadcast snapshots made by a smartphone.In reality: - Chromecast is too slow, so Full-HD movies or videos produce significant lags - Chromecast audio codec support is poor, so chances are you movie won't have sound - Slideshow of photos via Chromecast takes too long to load next image, so it is pain to wait - There are too few applications in Google Play that support Chromecast, and those that do in most cases are paid (or required in-app purchase to support Chromecast) - The Chrome browser plugin is not stable (at least on MacBook Air), it crashes periodically and requires restartThe only use case for Chromecast today is watching Youtube video, which it does pretty good (not counting a few minor issues).
author: Daniel
